thread.title: Manchester United news: Jose Mourinho on Marcus Rashford's lack of goals | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: Jose Mourinho on Marcus Rashford's lack of goals | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Manchester United news: Jose Mourinho on Marcus Rashford's lack of goals | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 7:35 am Jose Mourinho is not concerned by Marcus Rashford’s lack of goals (Picture: Getty) 
Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho admits that young striker Marcus Rashford is struggling with higher expectations after seeing the goals dry up a little this season. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The 19-year-old made a breathtaking start to life in the United first-team last term, scoring eight goals in his first 18 senior appearances for the Red Devils and going on to represent England at Euro 2016. 
Mourinho is a big fan of the teenage attacker, but admits he has a different challenge ahead of him this season after having to deal with more pressure as defenders wise up to him and everyone becomes more aware of what he’s capable of. Marcus Rashford hasn’t quite made the impact of last season (Picture: Getty) 
‘I’m always happy with Marcus Rashford’s contribution,’ Mourinho said. ‘He is one of those players that when he is on the pitch he tries when he always gives something. 
‘I know that last season under no pressure, last season in front of the goal, the goal was bigger. I know this season the expectations are higher, the pressure is higher and the goal is smaller.
